wikipedia_page.main:
John Monson Shaw (1 October 1832 – 4 September 1912) was an English amateur cricketer who played in three first-class cricket matches for Kent County Cricket Club in the 1860s.
Shaw was born at Cuxton near Rochester in Kent in 1832. He played cricket for a number of amateur sides in Kent between 1857 and 1867, particularly for the Gentlemen of Kent. His three first-class appearances for the county side came in 1865 and 1866. He died at Kirkley, part of Lowestoft in Suffolk, in 1912 aged 79.
